medtop:20001062.Definition (en-GB): Parachuting competitions with long distance falls without using a parachute

medtop:20001063.Definition (en-GB): A cue sport with balls on a table to be potted in a specific order

medtop:20001064.Definition (en-GB): Practiced with a single board (rather than two skis)

medtop:20001065.Definition (en-GB): A form of football played by two teams competing on a pitch by kicking a spherical ball. Points are scored by kicking or heading the ball into a goal. Governed by the Fédération Internationale de Football Association

medtop:20001066.Definition (en-GB): Similar to baseball but with a larger and softer ball, a thinner bat, shorter gaps between bases and less innings

medtop:20001067.Definition (en-GB): Timed races competed by two or more skaters at a time on an oval ice track

medtop:20000887.Definition (en-GB): Sport climbing as a special category: individual competition, on an artificial wall with time measurement

medtop:20001049.Definition (en-GB): Precision sport using a hand gun, rifle or shotgun

medtop:20001054.Definition (en-GB): Shooting event which involves shooting at special flying targets, known as clay pigeons or clay targets

medtop:20001052.Definition (en-GB): Shooting event with an airgun and a target that moves sideways

medtop:20001068.Definition (en-GB): A racquet sport of strategy and endurance played by singles or doubles teams in a walled court with a small rubber ball

medtop:20001307.Definition (en-GB): Water sport using a board and paddle to propel through the water while standing

medtop:20001069.Definition (en-GB): A combat sport of speed and rapidity with much ceremony where two contestants try to throw or slap a competitor out of a marked area. Generally practiced in Japan by large men.

medtop:20001070.Definition (en-GB): Water sport where contestants catch and ride waves upright on a surfboard

medtop:20001071.Definition (en-GB): A water sport where contestants swim as fast as possible in a given style and win races by being the first to touch home

medtop:20001072.Definition (en-GB): Swimming style, on the back, legs move in flapping motion whilst arms propel the swimmer forward

medtop:20001073.Definition (en-GB): Swimming style , on the front, effecting forward and outward push movements with the arms and backward and outward pushes with the legs

medtop:20001074.Definition (en-GB): Swimming style , swum on the front with the shoulders remaining parallel to the water both arms moving in simultaneous windmill fashion, the legs remain together and are moved in a flapping motion. The most physical of all styles.

medtop:20001075.Definition (en-GB): Any swimming style may be employed, though front crawl is universally employed

medtop:20001077.Definition (en-GB): A long distance open water swimming

medtop:20001076.Definition (en-GB): A combination of four different swimming styles in one race

medtop:20001078.Definition (en-GB): Team of swimmers swim a relay in the swimming style of their choice

medtop:20001079.Definition (en-GB): Team relay race involving a combination of four different swimming styles

medtop:20001080.Definition (en-GB): Races competed in a 25m length pool

medtop:20001083.Definition (en-GB): A racquet sport for two or four (in doubles), who compete at a table divided by a net using a small bat to play a lightweight ball

medtop:20001086.Definition (en-GB): A game in which a player scores points by trying to knock down ten 'pins' using a ball - if unsuccessful the player has a second attempt. A game consists of ten frames.

medtop:20001085.Definition (en-GB): A sport where two players, four in doubles, equipped with a racket compete by hitting the ball over a net into the opponent's side of the court with the aim of putting it out of reach within the regulation lines, thus winning points.

medtop:20001334.Definition (en-GB): Cycling competitions held on tracks, including sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit, omnium and madison events

medtop:20001087.Definition (en-GB): An endurance multi-sport where competitors first swim, then cycle and then run a road race. Distances vary according to the competition.

medtop:20001088.Definition (en-GB): Two teams pulling against each other on a rope

medtop:20001089.Definition (en-GB): Two teams of six record points by hitting a ball over a net into the opponent's half of the court, keeping it in the air at all times. Points are won when opponents fail to return the ball.

medtop:20001090.Definition (en-GB): Two teams of two players compete on a sand court. Unlike indoor volleyball, points are scored only when the serving team wins a rally or forces an error. The sand surface makes it more physically demanding than volleyball

medtop:20001091.Definition (en-GB): Played in a pool between two teams of 7, who must stay afloat and can only use one hand to pass the ball or swim with it before trying to throw it into the opponents net to score goals.

medtop:20001092.Definition (en-GB): On one or two skis contestants are pulled by a power boat along the water's surface

medtop:20001093.Definition (en-GB): A strength test where competitors lift as heavy a weight as possible

medtop:20001094.Definition (en-GB): The bar is first lifted to the shoulders and then jerk it above the head and keep it there while maintaining straight legs

medtop:20001095.Definition (en-GB): A strength test where competitors lift as heavy a weight as possible

medtop:20001096.Definition (en-GB): The bar must be lifted from floor to above the head in one movement

medtop:20001097.Definition (en-GB): Contestants must complete a marked out course as fast as possible on a windsurf board

medtop:20001098.Definition (en-GB): Combat sport where each wrestler attempts to win over his adversary, by holding both shoulders on the ground (fall) long enough to be in control. Points can also be decisive.

medtop:20001101.Definition (en-GB): Traditional Swiss sport similar to wrestling with specific rules

medtop:20001099.Definition (en-GB): A style where leg holds are allowed

medtop:20001100.Definition (en-GB): A style where the only holds allowed are those between the head and the belt

medtop:20001103.Definition (en-GB): Actions, including fines and suspensions levied by sports organisations and teams

medtop:20001104.Definition (en-GB): Drug use associated with sport activities, including doping, abuse, testing and permitted medical uses

medtop:20001105.Definition (en-GB): Using drugs to improve competitiveness in sports

medtop:20001106.Definition (en-GB): Means and ways to check the use of drugs in sports

medtop:20001107.Definition (en-GB): Use of drugs for medical reasons as permitted by sport regulators

medtop:20001301.Definition (en-GB): Records or honours earned by athletes for their performance

medtop:20001304.Definition (en-GB): Honour given to a player for achievements over a career, season or single event, unrelated to event outcome, usually awarded by a panel of judges or a popular vote. Examples include player of the game, most valuable player award or hall of fame induction.

medtop:20001303.Definition (en-GB): Award given to an athlete or team for placing in a sports competition, such as a gold medal at the Olympics or the Stanley Cup in ice hockey

medtop:20001302.Definition (en-GB): The best performance to date by an athlete or team in a sport discipline

medtop:20001108.Definition (en-GB): An event featuring one or more sport competitions

medtop:20001177.Definition (en-GB): Games organised by the International Olympic Committee and held each 4 years in summer or winter.

medtop:20001178.Definition (en-GB): Games for disabled athletes organised by the International Paralympic Committee and held each 4 years in winter or summer

medtop:20001109.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from countries from one continent may participate. Called a *Championship*

medtop:20001110.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from countries from one continent may participate. Called a *Cup*

medtop:20001111.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from countries from one continent may participate. Called *Games*

medtop:20001343.Definition (en-GB): Single game that determines the winner of a championship, such as the Super Bowl or Champions League Final

medtop:20001112.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from different countries may participate. Called a *Championship*

medtop:20001113.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from different countries may participate. Called a *Cup*

medtop:20001114.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from different countries may participate. Called *Games*

medtop:20001115.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from one country may participate. Called a *Championship*

medtop:20001116.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from one country may participate. Called a *Cup*

medtop:20001117.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from one country may participate. Called *Games*

medtop:20001342.Definition (en-GB): A competitive tournament, often played after the regular season of a sports league by the top competitors to determine the league champion or a similar accolade. Can also apply to an all-in elimination tournament meant to produce a final champion.

medtop:20001118.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from a region of a country may participate. Called a *Championship*

medtop:20001119.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from a region of a country may participate. Called a *Cup*

medtop:20001120.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from a region of a country may participate. Called *Games*

medtop:20001341.Definition (en-GB): A competitive sporting season where teams or individuals contend for a place in the standings or rankings

medtop:20001121.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from the five continents may participate. Called *World Championship*

medtop:20001122.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from the five continents may participate. Called *World Cup*

medtop:20001123.Definition (en-GB): A competition where individuals or teams from the five continents may participate. Called *World Games*

medtop:20001125.Definition (en-GB): Organisations or associations that govern sports

medtop:20001126.Definition (en-GB): Gymnasiums, stadiums, arenas or facilities where sports events take place

medtop:20001323.Definition (en-GB): The staff responsible for the training and on-field management of a sports team

medtop:20001324.Definition (en-GB): The executive leadership and owners of a sports team

medtop:20001325.Definition (en-GB): Referees, umpires and other staff who enforce the rules of a sport from on the field of play

medtop:20001148.Definition (en-GB): The transfer of an athlete from one team to another, the hiring or drafting of an athlete onto a team or the change in professional status of a player on a team

medtop:17000000.Definition (en-GB): The study, prediction and reporting of meteorological phenomena

medtop:20001128.Definition (en-GB): The long- or short-term meteorological prediction and reporting of the upcoming weather for a given region

medtop:20001129.Definition (en-GB): Short- or long-term meteorological phenomena worthy of study, reporting or public advisory such as climate change, storms, heat waves or tornadoes

medtop:20001130.Definition (en-GB): Numerical facts about the weather such as temperature, barometric pressure, river levels, humidity or high and low tides

medtop:20001131.Definition (en-GB): Alerts issued to the public about severe or notable weather in their area
